questions.text: Drugs least effective in severe covid-19 infection?
questions.solution: Favipiravir inhibits SARS-CoV-2 viral replication in vitro with evidence of clinical benefit in open label trials.

questions.text:
A patient presents with sudden severe pain in the first metatarso-phalangeal joint. Negatively birefringent crystals were seen in the joint fluid. Which of the following statements regarding drug usage in this patient is correct?
1. Aspirin should be used as it is the best pain relieving NSAID
2. Aspirin should not be used as it inhibits secretion of uric acid in tubules
3. Diclofenac is used as it is concentrated in joint spaces
4. Indomethacin is used since it has a pain relieving action
5. Indomethacin is not used because it can cause severe headache
questions.solution:
1. Aspirin is the best pain relieving NSAID. Hence it is true
  2. Aspirin interferes with urate excretion and antagonises the uricosuric effect of probenecid. However, at high doses (≥ 5 g/day) it may block urate reabsorption and increase its excretion, but aspirin is not a reliable uricosuric. Hence it is false
  3. Diclofenac being an acidic drug, tends to get concentrated in inflamed joint spaces. Hence it is correct
  4. Yes, Indomethacin is effective in pain relief.
  5. Indomethacin is used in treatment of severe headache. Hence statement 5 is false.

choices.text: Only anti parasitic drugs should be given
Anti parasitic drugs should be given and after the completion of course, Steroids should be given
Steroids should be started first followed by anti parasitic drugs
Only anti epileptic drugs should be given

questions.text: A patient presented with an episode of seizure and CT scan revealed presence of calcified cysts in brain with no evidence of Hydrocephalus. A diagnosis of Neurocysticercosis was made. Which of the following statements regarding treatment of this condition is correct?
questions.solution:
Steroids to be given first to prevent any hyperinflammatory syndrome due to dying parasites from Albendazole treatment.

Neurocysticercosis:

When albendazole/praziquantel is used to kill cysticerci lodged in the brain, prednisolone 40 mg/day or equivalent is given for 2-4 weeks to suppress the reaction to the dying larvae.

All other options are not the correct ways to treat the patient.

questions.text: Which of the following Antidepressants has the least sexual side effect?
questions.solution:
Mirtazapine: This antidepressant acts by a novel mechanism, viz. blocks α2 auto - (on NA neurons) and hetero - (on 5-HT neurons) receptors enhancing both NA and 5-HT release.

Accordingly, it has been labelled as "noradrenergic and specific-serotonergic antidepressant" (NaSSA).

Increased appetite and weight gain is frequent. Sexual dysfunction is not a problem with mirtazapine.

A. Fluoxetine: An SSRI, it has sexual side effects.

B. Imipramine: A Tricyclic antidepressant, has lesser sexual side effects as compared to SSRI

D. Venlafaxine: An SNRI, it has sexual side effects

Here is a list of anti depressants:

questions.text: Which of the following drugs used in Osteoporosis is a bone forming agent?
questions.solution:
Teriparatide, a recombinant Parathormone analogue acts by bone formation.

Teriparatide This recombinant preparation of 1-34 residues of the amino terminal of human PTH has been recently introduced for the treatment of severe osteoporosis. It duplicates all the actions of the long (1-84) PTH. It has been found to increase bone mineral density in osteoporotic women. The effect was faster and more marked than that produced by estrogens and bisphosphonates (BPNs).

Teriparatide is the only agent which stimulates new bone formation, whereas the other two only check bone resorption.

Here is the classification of drugs acting on bone presented in a table format:

choices.text: Suicidal risk due to overdose of the drug
Cardiac arrhythmia and seizures as toxic effects
Need to measure plasma levels by therapeutic drug monitoring

questions.text: Patient prescribed TCA for a depressive episode and stayed in hospital for 4 weeks and improved after 4 weeks. What is the main concern of the practitioner after discharging the patient?
questions.solution:
Cardiac arrhythmias and seizures are life threatening side effects of TCA drugs and hence are of major concern for the doctor.

Adverse effects of TCAs

Side effects are common with TCAs because of which SSRIs, SNRIs and atypical antidepressants have become the first line drugs.

  1. Anticholinergic: dry mouth, bad taste, constipation, epigastric distress, urinary retention blurred vision, palpitation.
  2. Sedation, mental confusion and weakness,
  3. Increased appetite and weight gain is noted with most TCAs and trazodone, but not with SSRIs, SNRIs and bupropion.
  4. Some patients receiving any antidepressant may abruptly to a dysphoric-agitated state or to mania. Probably, These are cases of bipolar depression, the other pole being unmasked by the antidepressant.
  5. Sweating (despite antimuscarinic action) and fine tremors are relatively common.
  6. Seizure threshold is lowered-fits may be precipitated, especially in children.
  7. Postural hypotension, especially in older patients. It is less severe with desipramine-like drugs.
  8. Sexual distress: especially delay or interference with erection, ejaculation and occasionally with orgasm.
  9. Cardiac arrhythmias, especially in patients with ischaemic heart disease. Arrhythmias may be responsible for sudden death in these patients.
  10. Rashes and jaundice due to hypersensitivity are rare.

A,D: Not common

C. Therapeutic drug monitoring should not be a cause of concern for this patient.

questions.text:
Read the following statements regarding the use of given drugs and choose the correct option.
1. Morphine is used for the treatment of pulmonary oedema
2. Indomethacin can be used in the treatment of headache
3. Aspirin is used in the treatment of dyspepsia
4. Pethidine can be used in treatment of biliary colic
questions.solution:
1. Morphine helps in pulmonary oedema by reducing the preload by redistributing the blood and therefore reducing the pulmonary capillary pressure.
  2. Indomethacin like many other NSAIDS inhibit the synthesis of prostaglandins and relieve symptom of headache.
  3. Aspirin is a non competitive inhibitor of COX and causes gastric ulcers, does not relieve dyspepsia.
  4. Opioids produce a general increase in resting tone of the gut wall and sphincters. These effects arise from stimulation of both µ- and κ-receptors on neuronal plexuses in the gut wall. An increase in biliary pressure caused by opioid-induced spasm at the sphincter of Oddi can exacerbate biliary colic. Hence, Pethidine can be used in the treatment of biliary colic.

questions.text: A patient with no history of angina or MI presents with new onset chest pain after taking a drug for migraine headache. The possible implicated drug is?
questions.solution:
5 HT agonists like Triptans and Ergot alkaloids have vasospastic effects causing angina like symptoms.

Variant angina Along with thromboxane A2, 5-HT released from platelets has been implicated in causing coronary spasm and variant angina.

However, the inefficacy of anti 5-HT drugs in this condition points to the involvement of other mediators.

Adverse effects of Ergot Alkaloids

Nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, muscle cramps, weakness, paresthesias, coronary and other vascular spasm, chest pain (due to coronary vasoconstriction) are the frequent side effects. These drugs are contraindicated in presence of sepsis, ischaemic heart disease, peripheral vascular disease, hypertension, pregnancy, liver and kidney disease.

Here is a list of all drugs used in Migraine:

Drug:
A. Meropenem
B. Metronidazole
C.Ceftriaxone
D. Vancomycin

Organism:
1. MRSA
2. Klebsiella pneumoniae
3. Hemophilus influenzae
4. Bacteroides
questions.solution:
Drugs Of Choice For Suspected or Proved Microbial Pathogens

Vancomycin: MRSA

Metronidazole: Bacteroides

Meropenem: Klebsiella pneumoniae

Ceftriaxone: Hemophilus influenzae

Reference: CMDT,2019

questions.text: All of the following drugs worsen myasthenia gravis except:
questions.solution:
Drugs that may exacerbate myasthenia gravis and potentiate the action of nondepolarizing muscle relaxants are:

  • Antibiotics
    • Aminoglycosides e.g Streptomycin
    • Tetracyclines
    • Quinolones e.g ciprofloxacin
    • Macrolides e.g erythromycin
  • Non-depolarizing muscle relaxants e.g d-Tubocurarine
  • Beta-blockers like propranolol, atenolol, metoprolol
  • Local anaesthetics
  • Botulinum toxin
  • Quinine derivatives like quinine, quinidine, chloroquine, mefloquine
  • Magnesium
  • Penicillamine

choices.text: TDM must be done for penicillin
TDM must be done for gentamicin
TDM done for both penicillin and gentamicin

questions.text: A patient was prescribed a high dose penicillin along with gentamicin for his symptoms. Which of the following statement is true regarding this:
questions.solution:
Therapeutic drug monitoring (TDM) is particularly useful in the following situations:

  1. Drugs with low safety margin, e.g. digoxin, anticonvulsants, antiarrhythmics, theophylline, aminoglycoside antibiotics, lithium, tricyclic antidepressants.
  2. If individual variations are large, e.g. antidepressants, lithium.
  3. Potentially toxic drugs used in the presence of renal failure, e.g. aminoglycoside antibiotics, vancomycin.
  4. In case of poisoning.
  5. In case of failure of response without any apparent reason, e.g. antimicrobials.
  6. To check patient compliance, e.g. psychopharmacological agents.

questions.text: Match the drug and antidotes combination:

choices.text: It acts as an anti craving agent for alcohol
If a person consumes alcohol after taking disulfiram, he feels drowsy with flushing face and breathing difficulty.
It can be used in a person who has negligible motivation to quit alcohol
Even after cessation of therapy, its effects persist for many days

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about Disulfiram?
questions.solution:
Aldehyde dehydrogenase inhibitor

Disulfiram: It inhibits the enzyme Aldehyde Dehydrogenase probably after conversion into active metabolites. When alcohol is ingested after taking disulfiram, the concentration of acetaldehyde in tissues and blood rises and a number of highly distressing symptoms (aldehyde syndrome) are produced promptly.

These are-flushing, burning sensation, throbbing headache, perspiration, uneasiness, tightness in chest, dizziness, vomiting, visual disturbances, mental confusion, postural fainting and circulatory collapse. Duration of the syndrome (1-4 hours)depends on the amount of alcohol consumed.

A. Disulfiram is an aversive agent and prevents relapse, whereas Acamprosate(NMDA blocker) acts as an anti craving agent for alcohol.

C. Disulfiram can't be used in a person who has negligible motivation to quit alcohol.

D. Even after cessation of therapy, effects might persist for few days only.

Here is a table summarizing the drugs used for alcohol deaddiction:

choices.text: Risk of bacterial contamination is high

questions.text: Which of the following is the most common drawback with the use of the device shown in the diagram?
questions.solution:
This is an image of Pressurised Metered dose inhaler(Pmdi).

INHALED ASTHMA MEDICATION

Four classes of antiasthma drugs, viz. β2 agonists, anticholinergics, Cromoglycate and glucocorticoids are available for inhalational use.

They are aimed at delivering the drug to the site of action so that lower dose is needed and systemic side effects are minimized.

Faster action of bronchodilators can be achieved compared to oral administration.

Aerosols are of two types:

  1. use drugs in solution: pressurized metered dose inhaler (MDI), nebulizers.
  2. use drugs as dry powder (DPI) spinhaler, rotahaler.

Pressurized metered dose inhalers use hydrofluoroalkane (HFA) propellants and deliver a specified dose of the drug in spray form per actuation. Use of chlorofluorocarbon (CFC) propellants is now banned due to their effect on the ozone layer.

Moreover, larger particles settle on the walls of the spacer reducing the fraction that deposits in the throat and is later swallowed. Local complications (candidiasis with inhaled steroids) as well as systemic exposure are reduced.

To prevent this: Gargling immediately after use or use spacers

  1. It is portable
  2. It can provide multiple doses
  3. Risk of bacterial contamination is low

questions.text: Which of the following drugs will not produce fixed dilated pupils?
questions.solution:
Pilocarpine causes marked sweating, salivation and increase in other secretions. The cardiovascular effects are complex. Small doses generally cause fall in BP (muscarinic), but higher doses elicit rise in BP and tachycardia which is probably due to ganglionic stimulation (through ganglionic muscarinic receptors).

Applied to the eye, it penetrates cornea and promptly causes miosis, ciliary muscle contraction and fall in intraocular tension lasting 4-8 hours.

1. 1:1000

questions.text: Which of the following is the only drug that reduces mortality in a patient with severe COVID-19 on respiratory support?
questions.solution:
Corticosteroids have mortality benefit in COVID 19 patients

Patients with severe or critical COVID-19 develop an overstimulation of the immune system, which can be very harmful to their health. Corticosteroids reduce this overstimulation, which helps balance the immune system responses so that they are effective and do not cause damage to the person themselves.

choices.text: Prescribe as there will be added beneficial effects
Prescribe as both of these drugs have different mechanisms to stop cough
Do not prescribe as different adverse effects of both the drugs will add up
Do not prescribe as this combination is irrational

questions.text: A new fixed dose combination of two drugs Codeine and Dextromethorphan for suppression of cough is launched. What should be your appropriate decision regarding this FDC?
questions.solution:
Codeine an opioid antitussive has addictive potential. Dextromethorphan, a newer opioid antitussive has less addictive potential and hence replaces Codeine as a cough suppressant.

This combination of Codeine and Dextromethorphan is itself irrational, as both drugs have same action and have no additive benefits.

Dextromethorphan

A synthetic central NMDA (N-methyl D-aspartate) receptor antagonist; the d-isomer has antitussive action while l-isomer is analgesic. Dextromethorphan does not depress mucociliary function of the airway mucosa and is practically devoid of constipating action.

Though considered non addicting, some drug abusers indulge in it.

Side effect: Dizziness, nausea, drowsiness; at high doses hallucinations and ataxia may occur.

Fixed dose combinations of a centrally acting antitussive with a bronchodilator or with an antihistamine having high atropinic activity have been banned in India, but many are still marketed.

Majority of the FDC cough formulations that are marketed and briskly advertised are irrational and have only placebo effect.

choices.text: Could not breath due to pelvic fracture
Respiratory depression and CO2 retention due to opioid

questions.text: A patient with pelvic fracture and head trauma with CT suggestive of raised ICT. Patient was given morphine for pain and respiratory difficulty followed. What could be the cause of this respiratory symptoms?
questions.solution:
Opioids like Morphine are notorious in causing respiratory depression and CO2 retention in trauma patients and hence it becomes difficult for doctors to detect the exact cause of this respiratory depression.

PRECAUTIONS AND CONTRAINDICATIONS of Morphine

Morphine is a drug of emergency, but due care has to be taken in its use.

  1. Infants and the elderly are more susceptible to the respiratory depressant action of morphine.
  2. It is dangerous in patients with respiratory insufficiency (emphysema, pulmonary fibrosis, cor pulmonale); sudden deaths have occurred.
  3. Bronchial asthma: Morphine can precipitate an attack by its histamine releasing action.
  4. Head injury: morphine is contraindicated in patients with head injury.

Reasons are

  • By retaining CO2, it increases intracranial tension which will add to that caused by head injury itself.
  • Even therapeutic doses can cause marked respiratory depression in these patients.
  • Vomiting, miosis and altered mentation produced by morphine interfere with assessment of progress in head injury cases.
  1. Hypotensive states and hypovolaemia exaggerate fall in BP due to morphine.
  2. Undiagnosed acute abdominal pain
  3. Elderly male: chances of urinary retention are high.
  4. Hypothyroidism, liver and kidney disease patients are more sensitive to morphine.
  5. Unstable personalities: are able to continue with its use and become addicted.

questions.text:
A patient presented with absence seizures. Which of the following drugs are useful for this patient?
1. Carbamazepine
2. Ethosuximide
3. Gabapentin
4. Valproate
Select the answer from the given below code:
questions.solution:
Absence seizure choice of drugs

1. Drug of choice(first line)

Valproate,(Atypical absence seizures)

Ethosuximide(Typical absence seizures)

2. Alternative drugs(second line)

Lamotrigine,

Clobazam,

Clonazepam

3. Add on drugs

Levetiracetam

Topiramate

Zonisamide

1. Carbamazepine is used for Focal seizures.

3. Gabapentin is for peripheral neuropathy.

questions.text: A 15 yr old female, complaints of cough and sore throat. She was prescribed an antibiotic, following which she came back with this symptom. Which drug would have caused it?
questions.solution:
Adverse effects of Penicillins

Penicillin G is one of the most nontoxic antibiotics; up to 20 MU has been injected in a day without any organ toxicity.

Local irritancy and direct toxicity Pain at i.m. injection site, nausea on oral ingestion and thrombophlebitis of injected vein are dose-related expressions of irritancy.

Accidental i.v. injection of procaine penicillin produces CNS stimulation, hallucinations and convulsions due to procaine.

Hypersensitivity An incidence of 1-10% is reported. Individuals with an allergic diathesis are more prone to develop penicillin reactions.

Frequent manifestations of penicillin allergy are-rash, itching, urticaria and fever. Wheezing, angioneurotic edema, serum sickness and exfoliative dermatitis are less common. Anaphylaxis is rare (1 to 4 per 10,000 patients), but may be fatal.
